communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Michael Cohen through his lawyer filed a FOIA request and got nothing back. https://x.com/michaelcohen212/status/1692609200583541078?s=46&t=axhEpTt0OokaaS32ajEiQA. We are unable to tell why. So, I am requesting these records: 

1. The FOIA request which you assigned tracking number 2023-03329

2. The tracking sheet your agency used to track the progress of this FOIA request 

3. Any agency communications describing whether and how to respond to this FOIA request 

and 

4. A copy of the documents that responsive to the FOIA request. For this part, please note that some may need to be partially redacted. In your adjudication letter, you threw in a laundry list of exemption codes, but these likely don’t justify withholding 873 pages in full. For B7A specifically, the mere pendency of enforcement proceedings is an inadequate basis for the invocation of B7(A) with showing that some distinct harm could reasonably be expected to result if the record or information requested were disclosed. Miller v. USDA, 13 F.3d 260, 263 (8th Cir. 1993)

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Hoppock

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Specifically, I am seeking the following information related to the Pleasantville Union Free School District's approach to generative AI, as outlined in Dr. Cameron Fadjo's recent presentation:

1. Minutes and Documents of the Generative AI Task Force: Any minutes, agendas, and documents related to the three meetings held in the spring of 2023, including ideas, concerns, and recommendations discussed.
2. Technology & Innovation Committee Records: Records of meetings, agendas, and recommendations related to generative AI from the standing district committee.
3. Staff Training Materials: Materials and guidelines used to train staff on the basics of generative AI.
4. Policies on Generative AI Usage: Information on the district's policies regarding the use of generative AI tools by staff and students, including privacy concerns and access restrictions.
5. Draft Position Statement: Any drafts or plans related to the district's upcoming position statement on the use of generative AI.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker
